title: Mint Leaf Storage Tips

items.name: Fresh mint (refrigerated)
items.details: Lasts about 7-10 days when stored properly in the refrigerator.

items.name: Damp paper towel method
items.details: Wrap mint in a damp paper towel and store in a plastic bag or airtight container in the fridge.

items.name: Bouquet method
items.details: Place stems in water like a bouquet, cover the leaves loosely with a plastic bag. Change the water every couple of days.

items.name: Freeze for long-term storage
items.details: Chop mint and place in ice cube trays with water or oil for long-term freezing.

items.name: Dried mint
items.details: Lasts 1-3 years if stored in an airtight container in a cool, dark place.

notes: Fresh mint benefits greatly from the bouquet/water method for maximum fridge life. Frozen mint cubes work well for cooking and beverages.
